intro: Baeothryon flavescens, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Cariophyllaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowering period usually occurs in the spring, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Baeothryon flavescens is often found in disturbed or open habitats, such as roadsides and dry meadows.
